commit_message:
Do not catch ConflictError on subscription create

Currently 'Subscription' class catches ConflictError inside and prints
text 'The subscriber has been existed already.'.

This is not good for two reasons:
1. The library user(program) wants to handle this exception by himself
using convenient try/except mechanism along with many other exceptions
that can happen during subscription creation.
2. The library user might not want some text to be printed in this
situation by python-zaqarclient. For now this is the only situation when
python-zaqarclient prints something when it is used as library.

This patch makes "Subscription" class not to handle ConflictError
exception by itself. And creates functional and unit tests to assert
that this behavior is raised, when Zaqar returns 409 response code on
subscription creation.

In the future it would be good to list all exceptions that can be raised
by the "Client" class's methods in their docstrings. See
"zaqarclient/queues/v1/client.py" and "zaqarclient/queues/v2/client.py".

Also it would be good if "Pool" and "Flavor" classes would throw
ConflictError exception too.

Closes-Bug: 1542780
Change-Id: I17c0e32a3dabec8303b3055a0d97db857d947b34
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient refs/changes/95/277195/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: data = client.subscription(parsed_args.queue_name, **kwargs) except Exception as ex: ex_name = type(ex).__name__ raise RuntimeError('Failed to create subscription for (%s), %s.' % (parsed_args.subscriber, ex_name))
deleted_lines: data = client.subscription(parsed_args.queue_name, **kwargs) if not data: raise RuntimeError('Failed to create subscription for (%s).' % parsed_args.subscriber)

commit_message:
Remove dependency on python2_lxc git source

The git source for python2_lxc was necessary before the package was
available on pypi, which it now is:
 - https://pypi.python.org/pypi/lxc-python2

This patch removes the py_from_git role dependency from the
lxc_hosts playbook, the role from the required roles list and the
repo details from the repo_packages as none of these are required.

Change-Id: Ia32665c9507b3a80096b201067f5329a1c3533fb

commit_message:
Added conditional templating

The change adds a conditional to the log rotate template
so that its only rendered when log files are present in the
log file discovery task.

This is a backport of https://review.openstack.org/273292

Closes-Bug: 1539210
Change-Id: I808143cfd0dd143b3bd5f835a1f7b0a8184d2c20
Depends-On: I3fba6eda958ce4f857dc5f06b5c700cbd3735c89
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/93/273293/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Union the log files set_fact: rsyslog_client_log_files: "{{ log_files.stdout_lines | union(rsyslog_client_log_files) }}" when: log_files.stdout_lines is defined tags: - rsyslog-client-config - name: Write log rotate file template: src: "os_aggregate_storage.j2" dest: "/etc/logrotate.d/{{ rsyslog_client_log_rotate_file }}" owner: "root" group: "root" when: (rsyslog_client_log_files | length) > 0 tags: - rsyslog-client-config

commit_message:
Filtering type extra-spec support to ZFSSA drivers

This change adds filtering type of extra specs to the ZFSSA drivers. It will
enable admins to create volume-types with the set of capabilities added by
this change.
Extra specs being added the ZFSSA iSCSI driver are: zfssa_poolprofile,
zfssa_volblocksize, zfssa_sparse, zfssa_compression, zfssa_logbias
Extra specs being added the ZFSSA NFS driver are: zfssa_poolprofile,
zfssa_sparse, zfssa_compression, zfssa_logbias, zfssa_encryption

Change-Id: I9167a50111f96921480dc30b350899035bf676bb
Implements: blueprint oracle-zfssa-extra-specs

commit_message:
Add define oslo::messaging::amqp

This patch aims to add a new define to manage parameters
in [oslo_messaging_amqp] which belongs to oslo.messaging.

Change-Id: If295b4375900f7f98d78deb7943d58f49fce811f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-oslo refs/changes/64/274764/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # == Define: oslo::messaging_amqp # # Configure oslo_messaging_amqp options # # This resource configures Oslo messaging resources for an OpenStack service. # It will manage the [oslo_messaging_amqp] section in the given config resource. # # === Parameters: # # [*server_request_prefix*] # (Optional) Address prefix used when sending to a specific server # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*broadcast_prefix*] # (Optional) address prefix used when broadcasting to all servers # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*group_request_prefix*] # (Optional) address prefix when sending to any server in group # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*container_name*] # (Optional) Name for the AMQP container # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*idle_timeout*] # (Optional) Timeout for inactive connections # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*trace*] # (Optional) Debug: dump AMQP frames to stdout # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*ssl_ca_file*] # (Optional) CA certificate PEM file to verify server certificate # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*ssl_cert_file*] # (Optional) Identifying certificate PEM file to present to clients # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*ssl_key_file*] # (Optional) Private key PEM file used to sign cert_file certificate # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*ssl_key_password*] # (Optional) Password for decrypting ssl_key_file (if encrypted) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*allow_insecure_clients*] # (Optional) Accept clients using either SSL or plain TCP # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*sasl_mechanisms*] # (Optional) Space separated list of acceptable SASL mechanisms # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*sasl_config_dir*] # (Optional) Path to directory that contains the SASL configuration # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*sasl_config_name*] # (Optional) Name of configuration file (without .conf suffix) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*username*] # (Optional) User name for message broker authentication # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*password*] # (Optional) Password for message broker authentication # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # define oslo::messaging_amqp( $server_request_prefix = $::os_service_default, $broadcast_prefix = $::os_service_default, $group_request_prefix = $::os_service_default, $container_name = $::os_service_default, $idle_timeout = $::os_service_default, $trace = $::os_service_default, $ssl_ca_file = $::os_service_default, $ssl_cert_file = $::os_service_default, $ssl_key_file = $::os_service_default, $ssl_key_password = $::os_service_default, $allow_insecure_clients = $::os_service_default, $sasl_mechanisms = $::os_service_default, $sasl_config_dir = $::os_service_default, $sasl_config_name = $::os_service_default, $username = $::os_service_default, $password = $::os_service_default, ){ create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/server_request_prefix' => { value => $server_request_prefix }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/broadcast_prefix' => { value => $broadcast_prefix }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/group_request_prefix' => { value => $group_request_prefix }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/container_name' => { value => $container_name }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/idle_timeout' => { value => $idle_timeout }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/trace' => { value => $trace }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/ssl_ca_file' => { value => $ssl_ca_file }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/ssl_cert_file' => { value => $ssl_cert_file }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/ssl_key_file' => { value => $ssl_key_file }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/ssl_key_password' => { value => $ssl_key_password }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/allow_insecure_clients' => { value => $allow_insecure_clients }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/sasl_mechanisms' => { value => $sasl_mechanisms }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/sasl_config_dir' => { value => $sasl_config_dir }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/sasl_config_name' => { value => $sasl_config_name }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/username' => { value => $username }}) create_resources($name, {'oslo_messaging_amqp/password' => { value => $password }}) }

commit_message:
Allow updating images via `tripleo.sh --overcloud-images`

Pass the `--update-existing` parameter to `openstack overcloud image
upload` to make it handle image rebuilds too.

Change-Id: I0974737ece7129a4528d37fd662189964d48a5b0

subject: Derive LIBS_FROM_GIT from ZUUL_CHANGES
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 04:59:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/39172fd43e3b620b6e90a2b4967397fed56720b5', 'message': 'Derive LIBS_FROM_GIT from ZUUL_CHANGES

Aka "Do-What-I-Mean with Depends-On in most cases"

This change derives LIBS_FROM_GIT from the projects listed in
ZUUL_CHANGES (generated from Depends-On), and the
DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT value used previously.

Combined with a devstack change to ignore unrecognised values in
LIBS_FROM_GIT, this should make Depends-On "just work" in many more
cases that previously required custom dsvm job-templates that
manipulated DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT.

To be clear, the behaviour is now:
- Used in a Depends-On:  Specific (unmerged) version is used from git
- In DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT but not Depends-On:  Uses git master
- In neither:  Uses pypi release

Change-Id: I87906e6410160047dbaf1807701ed5bd8af7f3af
Depends-On: Ic35b4cbfef6e19d2322bd19e0e31312c48642ecd

To be clear, the behaviour is now:
- Used in a Depends-On:  Specific (unmerged) version is used from git
- In DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT but not Depends-On:  Uses git master
- In neither:  Uses pypi release

Change-Id: I87906e6410160047dbaf1807701ed5bd8af7f3af
Depends-On: Ic35b4cbfef6e19d2322bd19e0e31312c48642ecd
'}]
commit_message:
Derive LIBS_FROM_GIT from ZUUL_CHANGES

Aka "Do-What-I-Mean with Depends-On in most cases"

This change derives LIBS_FROM_GIT from the projects listed in
ZUUL_CHANGES (generated from Depends-On), and the
DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT value used previously.

Combined with a devstack change to ignore unrecognised values in
LIBS_FROM_GIT, this should make Depends-On "just work" in many more
cases that previously required custom dsvm job-templates that
manipulated DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT.

To be clear, the behaviour is now:
- Used in a Depends-On:  Specific (unmerged) version is used from git
- In DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT but not Depends-On:  Uses git master
- In neither:  Uses pypi release

Change-Id: I87906e6410160047dbaf1807701ed5bd8af7f3af
Depends-On: Ic35b4cbfef6e19d2322bd19e0e31312c48642ecd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/49/282949/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LIBS_FROM_GIT=$( ( # Pull the project names out of ZUUL_CHANGES (aka Depends-On): # eg: openstack/nova:...^openstack/os-brick:...^openstack/foo:... echo $ZUUL_CHANGES | awk 'BEGIN{RS="^";FS="[:/]"}{print $2}' # Add DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT (comma separated) echo $DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT | awk 'BEGIN{RS=","}{print}' ) | sort | uniq | awk 'BEGIN{ORS=","}{print}') LIBS_FROM_GIT=$LIBS_FROM_GIT # In the future we might want to increase the number of compute nodes.
deleted_lines: LIBS_FROM_GIT=$DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT # In the future we might want to increase the number of compute nodes.

subject: Demote check_libs_from_git to non-fatal
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 04:51:32.000000000', 'files': ['inc/python'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/a41f8572dd30403334d804b3d5ec15f6472567a4', 'message': 'Demote check_libs_from_git to non-fatal

check_libs_from_git verifies that the names listed in LIBS_FROM_GIT are
in fact pip-installed things that look like they were installed from
git.  Previously, an unrecognised name resulted in a fatal error - this
change demotes that to a warning (and the unrecognised name is
effectively ignored).

This makes fat-fingered values less obvious, but opens the possibility
of auto-generating LIBS_FROM_GIT without knowing a-priori whether a git
repo name is going to be a pip-installed thing.

Change-Id: Ic35b4cbfef6e19d2322bd19e0e31312c48642ecd
'}]
commit_message:
Demote check_libs_from_git to non-fatal

check_libs_from_git verifies that the names listed in LIBS_FROM_GIT are
in fact pip-installed things that look like they were installed from
git.  Previously, an unrecognised name resulted in a fatal error - this
change demotes that to a warning (and the unrecognised name is
effectively ignored).

This makes fat-fingered values less obvious, but opens the possibility
of auto-generating LIBS_FROM_GIT without knowing a-priori whether a git
repo name is going to be a pip-installed thing.

Change-Id: Ic35b4cbfef6e19d2322bd19e0e31312c48642ecd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/48/282948/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: warn $LINENO "The following LIBS_FROM_GIT were not installed correct: $not_installed"
deleted_lines: die $LINENO "The following LIBS_FROM_GIT were not installed correct: $not_installed"

subject: stadium: Add a guideline about contributor overlap
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 18:55:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d43561d55eaaf6446531297136afcc4611a4144a', 'message': 'Update Neutron sub-project inclusion criteria.

There has been a lot of discussion about how the current "Neutron
stadium" is working out.  Consensus seems to be that it has grown
quickly beyond what makes since as a single official OpenStack team.
The first step for scaling things back is agreeing on some additional
inclusion criteria that helps with drawing the line for what should be
an independent OpenStack project.  See the following thread on the
mailing list for detailed discussion about this:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/080865.html

This patch implements a new compromise based on the above discussion.
It documents some criteria to guide the decision of whether a repository
makes sense to be under Neutron or a separate OpenStack project team.
It also documents the repository split based on this criteria.

There are likely a lot of questions about why a repository is in one
group or the other.  There is a ton of grey area and it's likely a waste
of time to try to elimitate all of it  I'll try to capture some of the
justification here for the less obvious cases:

Q: What about *aaS?  Should they be separate?

A: If they were started again today, they would very likely be done
   as new project teams.  They are kept under Neutron for now for
   historical reasons, but that may change for some *aaS in the future.

Q: Why is networking-ovs-dpdk separate?

A: The code in this repository is being folded into neutron, so
   we expect this repository to go away.

Q: Why is networking-onos separate?

A: ONOS is indeed open source, but the team seems largely independent
   and the repository has seen relatively few commits.

Q: Why is networking-l2gw included but networking-sfc separate?

A: In both cases, these are relatively new experimental APIs that
   are good candidates for being separated out.  networking-l2gw
   seems to have more significant team overlap, so it seems to
   make sense to keep it under Neutron for now.

Q: Why are -ovn and -odl included, but other drivers separate?

A: They fit the criteria of being open source and also having
   significant overlap with the main Neutron team.

Change-Id: Ie8e65a94ff9ec238e7c28a8b85d92835675d0c4c
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-03 21:19:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/706b8caf625e78928ad9fd629bb5758ac3d644f2', 'message': 'Update Neutron sub-project inclusion criteria.

Q: Why is -odl separate?

A: ODL is open source, but unlike OVN, it has additional functionality
   outside the scope of Neutron.

Co-Authored-By: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
Change-Id: Ie8e65a94ff9ec238e7c28a8b85d92835675d0c4c
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-03 21:40:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/bbe3c1a953ebf325af3824f55bc60dabf84b1aff', 'message': 'Update Neutron sub-project inclusion criteria.

There has been a lot of discussion about how the current "Neutron
stadium" is working out.  Consensus seems to be that it has grown
quickly beyond what makes sense as a single official OpenStack team.
The first step for scaling things back is agreeing on some additional
inclusion criteria that helps with drawing the line for what should be
an independent OpenStack project.  See the following thread on the
mailing list for detailed discussion about this:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/080865.html

This patch implements a new compromise based on the above discussion.
It documents some criteria to guide the decision of whether a repository
makes sense to be under Neutron or a separate OpenStack project team.
It also documents the repository split based on this criteria.

There are likely a lot of questions about why a repository is in one
group or the other.  There is a ton of grey area and it's likely a waste
of time to try to elimitate all of it  I'll try to capture some of the
justification here for the less obvious cases:

Q: What about *aaS?  Should they be separate?

A: If they were started again today, they would very likely be done
   as new project teams.  They are kept under Neutron for now for
   historical reasons, but that may change for some *aaS in the future.
   Octavia is the open source reference implementation for
   neutron-lbaas, so it remains included as well.

Q: Why is networking-ovs-dpdk separate?

A: The code in this repository is being folded into neutron, so
   we expect this repository to go away.

Q: Why is networking-onos separate?

A: ONOS is indeed open source, but the team seems largely independent
   and the repository has seen relatively few commits.

Q: Why is networking-l2gw included but networking-sfc separate?

A: In both cases, these are relatively new experimental APIs that
   are good candidates for being separated out.  networking-l2gw
   seems to have more significant team overlap, so it seems to
   make sense to keep it under Neutron for now.

Q: Why is -ovn included, but other drivers separate?

A: OVN fits the criteria of being open source and also having
   significant overlap with the main Neutron team.

Q: Why is -odl separate?

A: ODL is open source, but unlike OVN, it has additional functionality
   outside the scope of Neutron.

Co-Authored-By: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
Change-Id: Ie8e65a94ff9ec238e7c28a8b85d92835675d0c4c
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
stadium: Add a guideline about contributor overlap

This patch introduces a criterion whereby sub-projects are considered
for inclusion (or exclusion) under the Neutron fold based on team
overlap, i.e. on who is driving the development of the sub-project
from inception to production.

For instance, Neutron team members may occasionally need to create
new repos for experimentation, or for the development of new
(potentially overlapping) functional areas to be incubated as an
integral part of the Neutron end-to-end system.

This patch is the last in a series that introduces criteria for
classification of projects for inclusion/exclusion to/out of the
Neutron 'stadium'. These criteria will always be applied jointly
when assessing a project for inclusion/exclusion at discretion of
the Neutron team.

Patches that complete the inclusion/exclusion process will follow
to discuss the rationale for inclusion/exclusion of the remainder
of the sub-projects.

Change-Id: Ie8e65a94ff9ec238e7c28a8b85d92835675d0c4c
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Armando Migliaccio <armamig@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/88/275888/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: additional repository under the Neutron project. Projects should at least be set up based on these new project requirements:More importantly, the scope of the Neutron project must be constrained such that the Neutron team feels that they can vouch for the sub-project. At the end of the day, it's the decision of the PTL with input from the whole Neutron team. Here is some guidance to help figure out if a project should be within Neutron or separate in terms of OpenStack governance. * The team working on the sub-project should have significant overlap with the team doing core Neutron work. If the teams are mostly separate, that's a good sign that the project should be separate. * If the project only interacts with Neutron as a client of Neutron's REST API, it should be a separate project. python-neutronclient is an exception here. * Neutron stays busy enough just trying to develop reference implementations of features based on open source components. If a project exists to provide connectivity to a proprietary technology (or a mostly single vendor driven open source project), it should be a separate project. The end result should be a set of OpenStack projects that more accurately reflects the teams of people working on things. Being a separate OpenStack project team is just as official a part of OpenStack as being included under the Neutron team and provides the same benefits (ATC status, design summit space, etc). Repositories grouped together under the same team, such as Neutron, will share some common services from team members, such as the liasons to horizontal teams like infra or release management. The official source of all repositories that are a part of Neutron or another official OpenStack project team is here:We list the Neutron repositories, as well as other Neutron affiliated projects here to provide references and note the functionality they provide. Neutron projects ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This table shows the list of official Neutron repositories and their functionality. +-------------------------------+-----------------------+ | Name | Functionality | +===============================+=======================+ | networking-l2gw_ | l2 | +-------------------------------+-----------------------+ | networking-odl_ | ml2,l3,lb,fw | +-------------------------------+-----------------------+ | networking-ovn_ | core | +-------------------------------+-----------------------+ | neutron_ | base,l2,ml2,core,l3 | +-------------------------------+-----------------------+ | neutron-lbaas_ | lb | +-------------------------------+-----------------------+ | neutron-lbaas-dashboard_ | dashboard | +-------------------------------+-----------------------+ | neutron-fwaas_ | fw | +-------------------------------+-----------------------+ | neutron-lib_ | base | +-------------------------------+-----------------------+ | neutron-vpnaas_ | vpn | +-------------------------------+-----------------------+ | python-neutronclient_ | client | +-------------------------------+-----------------------+ - base: the base Neutron platform - client: API client implementation - dashboard: Horizon dashboard integrationNeutron +++++++ * Git: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron * Launchpad: https://launchpad.net/neutron .. _neutron: Neutron Client ++++++++++++++ * Git: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-neutronclient * Launchpad: https://launchpad.net/python-neutronclient .. _python-neutronclient: Neutron FWaaS +++++++++++++ * Git: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-fwaas * Launchpad: https://launchpad.net/neutron .. _neutron-fwaas: Neutron LBaaS +++++++++++++ * Git: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-lbaas * Launchpad: https://launchpad.net/neutron .. _neutron-lbaas: Neutron LBaaS Dashboard +++++++++++++++++++++++ * Git: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-lbaas-dashboard * Launchpad: https://launchpad.net/neutron .. _neutron-lbaas-dashboard: Neutron Library +++++++++++++++ * Git: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-lib * Launchpad: https://launchpad.net/neutron .. _neutron-lib: Neutron VPNaaS ++++++++++++++ * Git: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-vpnaas * Launchpad: https://launchpad.net/neutron .. _neutron-vpnaas:

commit_message:
Add events timeline and clock timer

This changes add a new 'events' extensions to manage
events timeline. Events are described in the events.yaml file.

The 'events' extensions will generate an rst document with:
* Timer clock for upcoming event
* Tabulated events list

Change-Id: Ib5c9d96663bd2197beea7aab226a3d46bc82067c

commit_message:
Zfssaiscsi driver should not use 'default' initiator group

The zfssaiscsi driver falls back to using the 'default'
initiator group when it fails to find a valid initiator group
configured. This causes all LUNs attached to instances on that
server to be presented to every server using the target group.

This fix makes the driver use the 'default' group only if
configured in the cinder.conf file. It also throws an error when
initiator group is given without any initiators.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I417688cf632baa727e5aa339c8d362761a38dcc8
Closes-Bug: #1508548

Closes-Bug: #1545836
"}]
commit_message:
Updating app domain model to contain scale_config

Updating the app domain model object with a field to
contain the scale_config information. This can be used
in the cli to display the target number of instances
that may have been requested using 'app scale' command.

Change-Id: If3e214064e107726ebbe1040ffee35a84ed32971
Closes-Bug: #1545836
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/77/280377/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: scale_config = wtypes.DictType( wtypes.text, wtypes.DictType(wtypes.text, wtypes.text)) 'raw_content'

commit_message:
Enable radosgw on restart
* Add 2 new parameters for radosgw start and enable after reboot
* Update test

Change-Id: Ib536c9499cf53d684d8fb8d5757fbe8d821f5ab3
Closes-Bug: 1538525
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/48/273048/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Author: Oleksiy Molchanov <omolchanov@mirantis.com># [*rgw_ensure*] Whether to start radosgw service. # Optional. Default is running. # # [*rgw_enable*] Whether to enable radosgw service on boot. # Optional. Default is true. # $rgw_ensure = running, $rgw_enable = true, if $rgw_enable { file { "${rgw_data}/done: ensure => present, before => Service["radosgw-${name}"], } } } elsif ($::operatingsystem == 'Debian') or ($::operatingsystem == 'RedHat') { if $rgw_enable { file { "${rgw_data}/done: ensure => present, before => Service["radosgw-${name}"], } } file { "${rgw_data}/sysvinit: ensure => present, before => Service["radosgw-${name}"], } start => 'service radosgw start', stop => 'service radosgw stop', status => 'service radosgw status', ensure => $rgw_ensure,
deleted_lines: $init = 'upstart' } elsif ($::operatingsystem == 'Debian') { $init = 'sysvinit' Service { name => "radosgw-${name}", start => "service radosgw start id=${name}", stop => "service radosgw stop id=${name}", status => "service radosgw status id=${name}", } } elsif ($::osfamily == 'RedHat') { $init = 'sysvinit' start => "service ceph-radosgw start id=${name}", stop => "service ceph-radosgw stop id=${name}", status => "service ceph-radosgw status id=${name}", ensure => running,

commit_message:
Bump allowed version of puppetlabs-concat

This change allows version 2.x of puppetlabs-concat as a dependency.
The module has been refactored as a resource type to improve reliability
and performance.

Change-Id: I0bac8e5ebd93d5fec804b8641fabcc83916de934
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/69/276969/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: on host, puppet('module install puppetlabs/concat --version ">=1.2.1 <3.0.0"'), { :acceptable_exit_codes => [0,1] }

commit_message:
The ceph extras location is no more.

From http://ceph.com/packages/ceph-extras/debian/
"The requested resource /packages/ceph-extras/debian/
is no longer available on this server and there is no forwarding
address. Please remove all references to this resource."

Change-Id: Ic37b3b047568418d70a49a72f5b77b5c42a330e7

commit_message:
Fixed typo in Dell Equallogic Cinder settings

The name of the variable ::eqlx_pool had a typo. Fixed it

commit_message:
clear the cache before mutating the config files

The __clear_cache decorator clears the cache only after calling the
wrapped function. We want changes to mutated options to be visible to
the mutate hooks invoked inside mutate_config_files, so we have to clear
the cache first.

Change-Id: I13bf21a3ab57d387297ade061b05573b06ca1332
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/63/283663/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.__cache.clear()

commit_message:
invert the order of endpoint and bind_service attributes

* endpoint type (admin, internal, public) and service (identitiy, network etc.)
  was switched during refactoring, this patch reverts this unintended switching

Change-Id: Ia5bddfc5e2fd77cd6e9e855c680b079f78fc1c3f
Depends-On: Iec485deaf415e4187a323435cce2b6bbadfc5d42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-identity refs/changes/97/279697/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default['openstack']['endpoints'][ep_type]['identity']['host'] = '127.0.0.1' default['openstack']['endpoints'][ep_type]['identity']['scheme'] = 'http' default['openstack']['endpoints'][ep_type]['identity']['path'] = '/v2.0' default['openstack']['bind_service'][ep_type]['identity']['host'] = '127.0.0.1' default['openstack'][type]['public']['identity']['port'] = 5000 default['openstack'][type]['internal']['identity']['port'] = 5001 default['openstack'][type]['admin']['identity']['port'] = 35357

commit_message:
use bind_service attribute instead of endpoints

* adapted server recipes to use the address and port defined in the bind_service
  attribute instead of the endpoint (endpoint can be different and should only
  be used by the services connecting to the db)
* changed get_password 'user' to 'db' for consitency with common


Depends-On: Iae7e302973805af3cb44be1b29d0e61e76eb0aa0
Implements: blueprint cookbook-refactoring
Change-Id: I0afb5942c38ed4e20037f553879de8e2c1a1f75f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-ops-database refs/changes/75/278875/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bind_db = node['openstack']['bind_service']['db'] if bind_db['interface'] listen_address = address_for bind_db['interface'] else listen_address = bind_db['host'] end node.override['mariadb']['mysqld']['bind_address'] = listen_addressunless listen_address == '127.0.0.1' || listen_address == 'localhost'

commit_message:
Nova Neutron configuration now uses keystone v3 endpoint

Our current nova-neutron configuration does not work with
the latest puppet-nova. In particular, this patch[1].

This commit adds keystone v3 endpoints to the map and gets the
nova::network::neutron configuration to use them.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/d09868a59c451932d67c66101b725182d7066a14

Change-Id: I87616782eac9d557404d3c2c3bcebac36c1dd797
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/90/278490/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: neutron_auth_url: {get_param: [EndpointMap, KeystoneV3Admin, uri]}

commit_message:
Reuse encodeutils.to_utf8()

oslo.utils 3.5 got a new to_utf8() function which can be used instead
of the common pattern:

    if isinstance(text, six.text_type):
        text = text.encode('utf-8')

Update oslo.utils requirements to get at least oslo.utils 3.5.

Change-Id: I4c708fa3c6bd18fdd8355fd63b11e43fea3ab6a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/13/280713/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import encodeutils body = encodeutils.to_utf8(body)

subject: Enable the Load Balancer v2 for the Ceilometer(Part One)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-01 06:56:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/ee9094cb434652ded93d22fa9b837740e33349d8', 'message': "Enable the Load Balancer v2 for the Ceilometer

In this change set, add the new methods:
list_pools_v2: Support to list the pools with Load Balancer v2 API.
list_members_v2: Support to list the members with Load Balancer v2
API.
list_health_monitors_v2: Support to list the health monitors with
Load Balancer v2 API.

In the Load Balancer v2, the responses of the Pool and Member don't
contian their status. And the status is included in the response of
status_tree[1].

We need to query the status_tree to determine the status of them.

[1]https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/LBaaS/API_2.0

Change-Id: Ibc49282fa39fed864ec9a54d1f7fb38d7034aa9d

list_health_monitors_v2: Support to list the health monitors with
Load Balancer v2 API.

In the Load Balancer v2, the responses of the Pool and Member don't
contian their status. And the status is included in the response of
status_tree[1].

We need to query the status_tree to determine the status of them.

[1]https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/LBaaS/API_2.0

Change-Id: Ibc49282fa39fed864ec9a54d1f7fb38d7034aa9d
Implements: blueprint lbaas-v2-enablement
DocImpact: a new option is introduced

commit_message:
Enable the Load Balancer v2 for the Ceilometer(Part One)

In this change set, add the new methods:
list_pools_v2: Support to list the pools with Load Balancer v2 API.
list_members_v2: Support to list the members with Load Balancer v2
API.
list_health_monitors_v2: Support to list the health monitors with
Load Balancer v2 API.

In the Load Balancer v2, the responses of the Pool and Member don't
contian their status. And the status is included in the response of
status_tree[1].

We need to query the status_tree to determine the status of them.

[1]https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/LBaaS/API_2.0

Change-Id: Ibc49282fa39fed864ec9a54d1f7fb38d7034aa9d
Implements: blueprint lbaas-v2-enablement
DocImpact: a new option is introduced
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/18/274518/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from neutronclient.v2_0 import client from oslotest import base from ceilometer import neutron_client class TestNeutronClientLBaaSV2(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestNeutronClientLBaaSV2, self).setUp() self.nc = neutron_client.Client() @staticmethod def fake_list_lbaas_pools(self): return { 'pools': [{ 'lb_algorithm': 'ROUND_ROBIN', 'protocol': 'HTTP', 'description': 'simple pool', 'admin_state_up': True, 'tenant_id': '1a3e005cf9ce40308c900bcb08e5320c', 'healthmonitor_id': None, 'listeners': [{ 'id': "35cb8516-1173-4035-8dae-0dae3453f37f" } ], 'members': [{ 'id': 'fcf23bde-8cf9-4616-883f-208cebcbf858'} ], 'id': '4c0a0a5f-cf8f-44b7-b912-957daa8ce5e5', 'name': 'pool1' }] } @staticmethod def fake_list_lbaas_members(self): return { 'members': [{ 'weight': 1, 'admin_state_up': True, 'subnet_id': '013d3059-87a4-45a5-91e9-d721068ae0b2', 'tenant_id': '1a3e005cf9ce40308c900bcb08e5320c', 'address': '10.0.0.8', 'protocol_port': 80, 'id': 'fcf23bde-8cf9-4616-883f-208cebcbf858' }] } @staticmethod def fake_list_lbaas_healthmonitors(self): return { 'healthmonitors': [{ 'admin_state_up': True, 'tenant_id': '6f3584d5754048a18e30685362b88411', 'delay': 1, 'expected_codes': '200,201,202', 'max_retries': 5, 'http_method': 'GET', 'timeout': 1, 'pools': [{ 'id': '74aa2010-a59f-4d35-a436-60a6da882819' }], 'url_path': '/index.html', 'type': 'HTTP', 'id': '0a9ac99d-0a09-4b18-8499-a0796850279a' }] } @staticmethod def fake_show_listener(self): return { 'listener': { 'default_pool_id': None, 'protocol': 'HTTP', 'description': '', 'admin_state_up': True, 'loadbalancers': [{ 'id': 'a9729389-6147-41a3-ab22-a24aed8692b2' }], 'tenant_id': '3e4d8bec50a845fcb09e03a4375c691d', 'connection_limit': 100, 'protocol_port': 80, 'id': '35cb8516-1173-4035-8dae-0dae3453f37f', 'name': '' } } @staticmethod def fake_retrieve_loadbalancer_status(self): return { 'statuses': { 'loadbalancer': { 'operating_status': 'ONLINE', 'provisioning_status': 'ACTIVE', 'listeners': [{ 'id': '35cb8516-1173-4035-8dae-0dae3453f37f', 'operating_status': 'ONLINE', 'provisioning_status': 'ACTIVE', 'pools': [{ 'id': '4c0a0a5f-cf8f-44b7-b912-957daa8ce5e5', 'operating_status': 'ONLINE', 'provisioning_status': 'ACTIVE', 'members': [{ 'id': 'fcf23bde-8cf9-4616-883f-208cebcbf858', 'operating_status': 'ONLINE', 'provisioning_status': 'ACTIVE' }], 'healthmonitor': { 'id': '785131d2-8f7b-4fee-a7e7-3196e11b4518', 'provisioning_status': 'ACTIVE' } }] }] } } } @mock.patch.object(client.Client, 'list_lbaas_pools') @mock.patch.object(client.Client, 'show_listener') @mock.patch.object(neutron_client.Client, '_retrieve_loadbalancer_status_tree') def test_list_pools_v2(self, mock_status, mock_show, mock_list): mock_status.return_value = self.fake_retrieve_loadbalancer_status(self) mock_show.return_value = self.fake_show_listener(self) mock_list.return_value = self.fake_list_lbaas_pools(self) pools = self.nc.list_pools_v2() self.assertEqual(1, len(pools)) for pool in pools: self.assertEqual('ONLINE', pool['status']) self.assertEqual('ROUND_ROBIN', pool['lb_method']) @mock.patch.object(client.Client, 'list_lbaas_pools') @mock.patch.object(client.Client, 'list_lbaas_members') @mock.patch.object(client.Client, 'show_listener') @mock.patch.object(neutron_client.Client, '_retrieve_loadbalancer_status_tree') def test_list_members_v2(self, mock_status, mock_show, mock_list_members, mock_list_pools): mock_status.return_value = self.fake_retrieve_loadbalancer_status(self) mock_show.return_value = self.fake_show_listener(self) mock_list_pools.return_value = self.fake_list_lbaas_pools(self) mock_list_members.return_value = self.fake_list_lbaas_members(self) members = self.nc.list_members_v2() self.assertEqual(1, len(members)) for member in members: self.assertEqual('ONLINE', member['status']) self.assertEqual('4c0a0a5f-cf8f-44b7-b912-957daa8ce5e5', member['pool_id']) @mock.patch.object(client.Client, 'list_lbaas_healthmonitors') def test_list_health_monitors_v2(self, mock_list_healthmonitors): mock_list_healthmonitors.return_value = self.\ fake_list_lbaas_healthmonitors(self) healthmonitors = self.nc.list_health_monitors_v2() self.assertEqual(1, len(healthmonitors)) for healthmonitor in healthmonitors: self.assertEqual(5, healthmonitor['max_retries'])

commit_message:
Skip Heat neutron tests

Heat neutron resource stack tests are failing continuously
on gate. Failure is because of not creating the subnet on network.

This commit skip all tests till bug 1547261 is fixed.

Change-Id: I5317f1cc7ebba26a926898dc54e0109a98ca181f
Related-Bug: #1547261
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/38/283238/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = "Skipped until Bug: 1547261 is resolved." raise cls.skipException(msg)

The correct value is not 202 but 204.

Closes-Bug: #1543537

  * GET    v2.0/floatingips
  * POST   v2.0/floatingips
  * GET    v2.0/floatingips/{floatingip_id]

commit_message:
Revert remove-router-interface and floatingip API

This commit reverts following APIs:

  * PUT    v2.0/routers/{router_id}/remove_router_interface
  * GET    v2.0/floatingips
  * POST   v2.0/floatingips
  * GET    v2.0/floatingips/{floatingip_id]
  * PUT    v2.0/floatingips/{floatingip_id]
  * DELETE v2.0/floatingips/{floatingip_id]

Change-Id: Ia392a8c8c26192a3064b621f519253e6ce4273b9
Closes-Bug: #1545213

commit_message:
Enable auto discovery

This patch enables auto discovery of static resources so that we no longer
have to manually type them in. This mechanism enables faster development
and is less error prone.

Change-Id: I3c6fbf8f73e6e23ca4c20ef325aee9a4fb486a4a

commit_message:
Enhance UI content guidelines

Added content for consistent text/icon
formatting in the UI. Also, included
considerations for when to use text vs
icons.

Change-Id: I0951e1b5c3c5dedfea7e0d873016e6e231864e2a
Implements: blueprint ui-content-guidelines
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/19/282019/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _uipanelformatting: =================================== Use recommended UI panel formatting =================================== It is important to use consistent style and placement for text and icons in the UI. .. In progress. please edit, add, etc... Workflow navigation text ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Use default values for page/window title bars, side navigation, fonts, and text size. For example, tab titles must be a smaller text size than the section heading. Similarly, the node item title must be a smaller font than the page/window title. If necessary, you might have to shorten the node item title in order to maintain the default width. .. note:: The image below is not to scale. It is only intended as a reference for the various UI elements mentioned. .. image:: ../figures/ui-text-cheatsheet.jpg :alt: UI text cheat sheet Icons ~~~~~ Be selective when deciding to use icons instead of text. It is often difficult for users to understand the intent of an icon. New icons should be thoroughly reviewed and tested by the user experience project. That said, icons can improve usability in specific instances. For example: * You have limited space. * The icon is quickly recognizable. (note: consider global audiences and whether the icon is recognizable across cultural differences) * The icon enhances design appeal. If you decide to use an icon, follow these tips: * Keep the design simple and consistent. * Keep the location of individual icons consistent. Users recognize and expect patterns which help to establish meaning and function. * Ensure the icon is quickly recognizable and memorable. For help, work with the UX project. * If there is space, consider adding a text label to the icon.

subject: Override OS::Nova::Server for user_data updates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-23 04:19:51.000000000', 'files': ['elements/undercloud-heat-plugins/install.d/55-install-undercloud-heat-plugins', 'elements/undercloud-heat-plugins/server_update_allowed.py', 'json-files/centos-7-undercloud-packages.json', 'json-files/rhel-7-undercloud-packages.json'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/b457ddb50229d76737ebad269998c980d77ac234', 'message': 'Override OS::Nova::Server for user_data updates

This change adds an element which installs a plugin to /usr/lib/heat.
This plugin replaces the OS::Nova::Server type which a subclass that
will not replace heat servers on stack-update when the user_data
property is changed.

"openstack undercloud install" needs to be run to install this plugin.
Any undercloud heat can be tested for whether servers are replaced on
user_data changes by running:

  heat resource-type-show OS::Nova::Server | \
    jq '.properties.user_data.update_allowed'

The result will be 'true' when this change has been successfully
applied.

The intention is that this is backported to stable/liberty to allow
overclouds to be upgraded from kilo to liberty. This issue can be fixed
in heat for Mitaka but that heat change can't be backported to Liberty.

Change-Id: Ie5263ed8e51a4b3970b77a7ecf7f0642fe50d7f8
Closes-Bug: #1539541
'}]
commit_message:
Override OS::Nova::Server for user_data updates

This change adds an element which installs a plugin to /usr/lib/heat.
This plugin replaces the OS::Nova::Server type which a subclass that
will not replace heat servers on stack-update when the user_data
property is changed.

"openstack undercloud install" needs to be run to install this plugin.
Any undercloud heat can be tested for whether servers are replaced on
user_data changes by running:

  heat resource-type-show OS::Nova::Server | \
    jq '.properties.user_data.update_allowed'

The result will be 'true' when this change has been successfully
applied.

The intention is that this is backported to stable/liberty to allow
overclouds to be upgraded from kilo to liberty. This issue can be fixed
in heat for Mitaka but that heat change can't be backported to Liberty.

Change-Id: Ie5263ed8e51a4b3970b77a7ecf7f0642fe50d7f8
Closes-Bug: #1539541
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/79/283379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Run packstack jobs inside a root shell
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 20:47:54.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/packstack.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/68f2b0f283b843ba4faf06cd25957d828ba97d52', 'message': 'Run packstack jobs inside a root shell

Packstack was designed to run as the root user. After many unfruitful
attempts to get everything to work properly with sudo inside the gate,
we will simply run everything inside a root shell.

Additionally, Packstack will connect to localhost as root and the
added builder allows to do that without needing to put the logic
inside the run_tests wrapper.

Change-Id: I0de86d63c357de5ee2c339627fa6f7095e01e284
'}]
commit_message:
Run packstack jobs inside a root shell

Packstack was designed to run as the root user. After many unfruitful
attempts to get everything to work properly with sudo inside the gate,
we will simply run everything inside a root shell.

Additionally, Packstack will connect to localhost as root and the
added builder allows to do that without needing to put the logic
inside the run_tests wrapper.

Change-Id: I0de86d63c357de5ee2c339627fa6f7095e01e284
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/15/275915/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - allow-local-ssh-root export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/sbin sudo bash -c "SCENARIO={scenario} ./run_tests.sh"

commit_message:
Fix string interpolation at logging call

Skip creating the formatted log message
if the message is not going to be emitted
because of the log level.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Ic35b67bc43c77a086409bed57b846f729300d5c0

commit_message:
Add reno release notes to tempest-lib

This commit adds reno release notes to the tempest-lib to track the
changes each release. It adds a note for the upcoming deprecation of
tempest-lib in the next release.

Partially implements bp tempest-lib-reintegration
Change-Id: I651eecf3ad40a0d8acf0305d200555f97f50bea5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest-lib refs/changes/18/283618/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > Starting with tempest-lib 1.0.0 the tempest-lib development has moved back into the tempest repository. After this release to get future code updates to tempest-lib code you need change your requirements to require tempest instead of tempest-lib and update your tepmest_lib imports to use tempest.lib instead. deprecations: - Tempest-lib itself is deprecated. Development of the tempest library interface will occur in tempest in the future. critical: - The 1.0.0 release is the last planned release for tempes-lib. All future development for the library interface will occur in tempest in the future.

commit_message:
added helper method bind_address

* helper method bind_address should return the address for a given service
config, if an :interface is defined, it should return the address on the
interface, else it will just return the :host

Change-Id: I80ba506f7d9a745c3f4c47a78099199195abd9ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-common refs/changes/79/280579/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def bind_address(service_config) iface = service_config['interface'] if iface address = address_for(iface) else address = service_config['host'] end address end

commit_message:
Add request_ids attribute to resource objects

Added request_ids attribute to resource object for all the
volume_backups, volume_encryption_types and volume_transfers
APIs by updating following APIs:

volume_backups: reset_state, delete, export_record, import_record
volume_transfers: delete
volume_encryption_types: list

Returning list with request_ids as attribute in case of 'list' API
for volume_encryption_types.

These changes are required to return 'request_id' from client to log
request_id mappings of cross projects.

For more details on how request_id will be returned to the caller,
please refer to the approved blueprint [1] discussed with the
cross-project team.
[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/return-request-id.html

DocImpact
'request-ids' will be returned as an attribute with response object.
User can access it using 'res.request_ids' where 'res' is a
response object.

Change-Id: I2197ca38f6c9a8b0ced5c82d29676b49c9700b09
Partial-Implements: blueprint return-request-id-to-caller

commit_message:
Add request_ids attribute to resource objects

Added request_ids attribute to resource object for all the
cgsnapshots, consistencygroups, qos_specs, quota_classes,
quotas and services APIs by updating following APIs:

cgsnapshots: delete, update
consistencygroups: delete, update, create
qos_specs: delete, associate, disassociate, disassociate_all
quota_classes: update
quotas: update
services: enable, disable, disable_log_reason

These changes are required to return 'request_id' from client to
log request_id mappings of cross projects.

For more details on how request_id will be returned to the caller,
please refer to the approved blueprint [1] discussed with the
cross-project team.
[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/return-request-id.html

DocImpact
'request-ids' will be returned as an attribute with response object.
User can access it using 'res.request_ids' where 'res' is a
response object.

Change-Id: I7b399512fcec9ecd31938656deb60e325bb76ad4

commit_message:
Fix sort problem in snapshot and backup list

The sort in command snapshot-list and backup-list
doesn't work, and they show same results.

The patch is to fix the problem, and transfer
sortby_index as None in utils.print_list.

Closes-Bug: #1536054

Change-Id: I00760fd4b395b04b95a8139224e18ea8d649d377
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/58/270058/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if args.sort: sortby_index = None else: sortby_index = 0 ['ID', 'Volume ID', 'Status', 'Name', 'Size'], sortby_index=sortby_index) if args.sort: sortby_index = None else: sortby_index = 0 utils.print_list(backups, columns, sortby_index=sortby_index)

commit_message:
Add request_ids attribute to resource objects

Added request_ids attribute to resource object for all the volume,
volume_types, volume_type_access and volume_snapshots APIs by
updating following APIs:

volumes: delete, update, force_delete, reset_state, extend,
migrate_volume, retype, update_readonly_flag, manage, unmanage,
promote, reenable, get_pools, initialize_connection,
terminate_connection, get_encryption_metadata

volume_types: delete
volume_type_access: add_project_access remove_project_access
volume_snapshots: delete and update

Returning list with request_ids as attribute in case of
'delete_metadata' and 'delete_image_metadata' APIs.

These changes are required to return 'request_id' from client to
log request_id mappings of cross projects.

For more details on how request_id will be returned to the caller,
please refer to the approved blueprint [1] discussed with the
cross-project team.
[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/return-request-id.html

DocImpact
'request-ids' will be returned as an attribute with response object.
User can access it using 'res.request_ids' where 'res' is a
response object.

Change-Id: Icc4565291220278a65e6910a840fba623b750cc4
Partial-Implements: blueprint return-request-id-to-caller

commit_message:
Provide consistency for Wrapper classes

Updated TupleWithMeta class to make it consistent with other Meta
classes in order to avoid confusion. Also made provision to call
TupleWithMeta with a tuple containing one or more elements.

For more details on how request_id will be returned to the caller,
please refer to the approved blueprint [1] discussed with the
cross-project team.
[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/return-request-id.html

Change-Id: I5a79a4ed8cb4dc83ea3b64499df191750462100d
Partial-Implements: blueprint return-request-id-to-caller

deleted_lines: def __new__(cls, resp, values): return super(TupleWithMeta, cls).__new__(cls, (resp, values)) def __init__(self, resp, values):

commit_message:
database and message queue refactoring

* adapted the database and message queue attributes to fit to the ones used for
  the openstack services
* added optional attribute to allow setting an specific endpoint for the db root
  user (useful in hardening scenarios)

Implements: blueprint cookbook-refactoring
Change-Id: Iae7e302973805af3cb44be1b29d0e61e76eb0aa0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-common refs/changes/64/278864/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: %w(endpoints bind_service).each do |type| default['openstack'][type]['db']['host'] = '127.0.0.1' default['openstack'][type]['db']['port'] = '3306' end default['openstack']['bind_service']['db']['interface'] = nil# If you bind the database to a specific ip-address (you can only choose one # here for mysql, so 127.0.0.1 + external address is not an option), to allow # the services and applications to access it via this one, you probably do not # want to allow the db root user to access it via this external address. In this # case you have the option to allow root access only via localhost, which # will work for mysql databases, since it will use a direct connection via # the socket, so the database does not have not to listen on 127.0.0.1. default['openstack']['endpoints']['db']['root'] = nil

commit_message:
Hyper-V: os_win related updates

Hyper-V / Windows related constants have been moved into os_win.constants
and they should be used instead.
SMB related utils have been moved from pathutils into smbutils.
Metrics related utils have been refactored into metricsutils.

Change-Id: I7007f77f51755cf3f8ab85402d39f10d7af749b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/07/262007/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from os_win import constants as os_win_const for fkey, fname in os_win_const.PROCESSOR_FEATURE.items():

commit_message:
XenAPI: Fix VIF plug and unplug problem

When vif.plug is called, XenAPI's vif plug does not plug a device,
but returns a dictionary of the vif record. This is not vif.plug is
expected to do. This fix will create a new VIF when vif_driver.plug
is called and destroy this VIF when vif_driver.unplug is called

Change-Id: I1eb4cc3b1c44662fb3063a854880ebf79fcf6942
Closes-Bug: #1521977

ret_vif_ref = self.base_driver._get_vif_ref(vif, vm_ref) self.assertEqual(vif_refs[0], ret_vif_ref) class XenAPIBridgeDriverTestCase(XenVIFDriverTestBase): def setUp(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(network, 'get_meta') network.get_meta('should_create_vlan').AndReturn(True) vif = Fake_Vif() vif['network'] = network vif['address'] = "fake_address" network_ref = "fake_network_ref" self.bridge_driver._ensure_vlan_bridge( vif['network']).AndReturn(network_ref) vm_ref = "fake_vm_ref" device = 1 vif_rec = {} vif_rec['device'] = str(device) vif_rec['network'] = network_ref vif_rec['VM'] = vm_ref vif_rec['MAC'] = vif['address'] vif_rec['MTU'] = '1500' vif_rec['other_config'] = {} vif_rec['qos_algorithm_type'] = '' vif_rec['qos_algorithm_params'] = {} vif_ref vm_ref, device) self.assertEqual(vif_ref, ret_vif_ref) def test_unplug(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(vm_utils, 'lookup') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self._session, 'call_xenapi') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.bridge_driver, '_get_vif_ref') instance = {'name': "fake_instance"} vm_ref = "fake_vm_ref" vm_utils.lookup(self._session, instance['name']).AndReturn(vm_ref) vif_ref = self.mox.ReplayAll() self.bridge_driver.unplug(instance, vif) self.mox.VerifyAll() class XenAPIOpenVswitchDriverTestCase(XenVIFDriverTestBase): def setUp(self): super(XenAPIOpenVswitchDriverTestCase, self).setUp() self.ovs_driver = vif.XenAPIOpenVswitchDriver(self._session) def tearDown(self): super(XenAPIOpenVswitchDriverTestCase, self).tearDown() def test_plug(self): network_utils.find_network_with_bridge(self._session, 'xapi1').AndReturn(network_ref) vif = {'address': "fake_address", 'id': "fake_vif_id"} device = 1 vm_ref = "fake_vm_ref" vif_rec = {} vif_rec['device'] = str(device) vif_rec['network'] = network_ref vif_rec['VM'] = vm_ref vif_rec['MAC'] = vif['address'] vif_rec['MTU'] = '1500' vif_rec['qos_algorithm_type'] = '' vif_rec['qos_algorithm_params'] = {} vif_rec['other_config'] = {'nicira-iface-id': vif['id']} vif_ref = "fake_vif_ref" self._session.call_xenapi('VIF.create', vif_rec).AndReturn(vif_ref) self.mox.ReplayAll() instance = {'name': "fake_instance_name"} ret_vif_ref = self.ovs_driver.plug(instance, vif, vm_ref, device) self.assertEqual(vif_ref, ret_vif_ref) def test_unplug(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(vm_utils, 'lookup') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self._session, 'call_xenapi') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.ovs_driver, '_get_vif_ref') instance = {'name': "fake_instance"} vm_ref = "fake_vm_ref" vm_utils.lookup(self._session, instance['name']).AndReturn(vm_ref) vif_ref = "fake_vif_ref" vif = "fake_vif" self.ovs_driver._get_vif_ref(vif, vm_ref).AndReturn(vif_ref) self._session.call_xenapi('VIF.unplug', vif_ref) self._session.call_xenapi('VIF.destroy', vif_ref) self.mox.ReplayAll() self.ovs_driver.unplug(instance, vif) self.mox.VerifyAll()

commit_message:
invert the order of endpoint and bind_service attributes

* endpoint type (admin, internal, public) and service (identitiy, network etc.)
  was switched during refactoring, this patch reverts this unintended switching

Change-Id: Iec485deaf415e4187a323435cce2b6bbadfc5d42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-common refs/changes/96/279696/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: uri_from_hash(node['openstack']['endpoints'][ep_type][service])

subject: DO NOT MERGE: Ugly hack for mtu
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-09 18:47:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/d5191fcbf027a7b42d8a1ef63d2ae5098c7c5047', 'message': "DO NOT MERGE: Ugly hack to ram 1450 mtu down to all interfaces

Since Neutron doesn't currently do anything for the network_device_mtu
automatically.

1450 is picked due to 1500 MTU for physical devices - less 50 byte
overhead for VXLAN.

Change-Id: I9ea2a1395dabca28f67352a7df71508fcc9be5fd

"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-10 18:02:05.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/ml2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/41a0579489ae00155b01d731e316bf385517c18d', 'message': "DO NOT MERGE: Ugly hack for mtu

Try forcing everything to 1446 mtu (1500 - 4 bytes for GRE - 50 for VXLAN).

Seriously i'm just throwing stuff at the wall here. Help.


Change-Id: I9ea2a1395dabca28f67352a7df71508fcc9be5fd
"}]
commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Ugly hack for mtu

Try forcing everything to 1446 mtu (1500 - 4 bytes for GRE - 50 for VXLAN).

Seriously i'm just throwing stuff at the wall here. Help.


Change-Id: I9ea2a1395dabca28f67352a7df71508fcc9be5fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/28/278028/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ugly hack iniset /$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE ml2 network_device_mtu 1450

subject: Update data model conversion to be more complete
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-15 11:27:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/10eb843011dd99809e22174c132846cc3966b2ca', 'message': "Update data model conversion to be more complete

Prior to this patch, the conversion from database model to
data model tried various recursive strategies based on object
class tracking, aimed at avoiding too many recursive back-references
to other models in the object tree in order to avoid an infinite
recursion. While this worked reasonably well, it resulted in
data model trees that would become increasingly inaccurate if
too many links were traversed away from the original object from
which the tree was generated (ie. the defacto root of the tree
that had been generated).

This problem became worse when the tree became a graph with the
introduction of the shared pools code, and the work-around for
the graph inaccuracy problem greatly increased the inefficiency
of generating the graph. (It's an O(n^2) or worse algorithm.)

This patch introduces a new strategy for generating the data model
graph based on tracking unique ID of the objects in the graph, and
making all back-references complete. By generating the graph this
way, not only do we have a complete and accurate data model graph
which should remain accurate no matter how many object links are
traversed (ie. this is a true graph and not an approximation of
a graph using a tree), but we have increased the efficiency of the
graph generation algorithm to O(n).

commit_message:
Update data model conversion to be more complete

Prior to this patch, the conversion from database model to
data model tried various recursive strategies based on object
class tracking, aimed at avoiding too many recursive back-references
to other models in the object tree in order to avoid an infinite
recursion. While this worked reasonably well, it resulted in
data model trees that would become increasingly inaccurate if
too many links were traversed away from the original object from
which the tree was generated (ie. the defacto root of the tree
that had been generated).

This problem became worse when the tree became a graph with the
introduction of the shared pools code, and the work-around for
the graph inaccuracy problem greatly increased the inefficiency
of generating the graph. (It's an O(n^2) or worse algorithm.)

This patch introduces a new strategy for generating the data model
graph based on tracking unique ID of the objects in the graph, and
making all back-references complete. By generating the graph this
way, not only do we have a complete and accurate data model graph
which should remain accurate no matter how many object links are
traversed (ie. this is a true graph and not an approximation of
a graph using a tree), but we have increased the efficiency of the
graph generation algorithm to O(n).

Partial-Bug: 1544851
Change-Id: I68c2ff0e293e3a1ea4e7b0fd38cf6d0d5cd4ec12

Add an experiment job for Neutron FWaaS tempest tests

This job runs tests in tempest plugin provided by
neutron-fwaas repository.

commit_message:
Get kafka notifications to work with kafka-python 0.9.5

* poll() now returns empty list instead of None
* metadata_broker_list has been dropped, there's a new
  bootstrap_servers
* Add a LOG.debug() for the actual message

python simulator.py -d DEBUG --topic notifications.info --url kafka://localhost:9092 notify-server
python simulator.py -d DEBUG --topic notifications --url kafka://localhost:9092 notify-client -m 1000 -w 1

More tips:
http://kafka.apache.org/documentation.html#quickstart
https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-install-apache-kafka-on-ubuntu-14-04

Depends-On: Ia324b4c89b05c536708baf7950857cd159578cec

commit_message:
Remove glance constraints jobs

Since the python jobs are constraint enabled, there's no need for
separate constraint jobs for glance anymore, remove them.

Change-Id: Ia08c15914d9dbfc3f5dc04ca69a7be26efb6fe64
Needed-By: I218f16c585b7b8a9ea73c6cf1c5b0aef2dcde015

commit_message:
Improve the existence check of tempest-lib modules

Current the existence check of tempest-lib modules is just for
non-existence module only. However, the modules of the same name
exist in tempest-lib between compute clients and network clients.
So the script should check the existence of multiple modules.

Change-Id: Icf3acb7834711ef5f52bb76b277288c3231cf506
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/05/279505/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: num_lib_path=`find ./ -name $filename | wc -l` if [ $num_lib_path -ne 1 ]; then if [ $num_lib_path -eq 0 ]; then echo "ERROR: $filename does not exist in tempest-lib." else echo "ERROR: Multiple $filename exist in tempest-lib." fi
deleted_lines: if [ -z $lib_path ]; then echo "ERROR: $filename does not exist in tempest-lib."

commit_message:
Set container apt sources to use a configured list of components

re: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-February/086000.html

Ubuntu has 4 different 'components' - main, universe, multiverse and
restricted:
 - Main: Officially supported software.
 - Restricted: Supported software that is not available under a completely
               free license.
 - Universe: Community maintained software, i.e. not officially supported
             software.
 - Multiverse: Software that is not free.

Practically speaking there should be nothing particularly useful to
OpenStack-Ansible in Restricted or Multiverse - it's mostly software for
desktop users.

This patch introduces a new variable 'lxc_container_template_apt_components'
which is a list of the components to configure in the apt sources list. The
default list does not include the unnecessary components.

Change-Id: I0eef6454d273f5ba1977a68151fbf6103ff3ed8d

subject: Add /usr/local/{sbin,bin} to rootwrap exec_dirs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 07:08:15.000000000', 'files': ['etc/rootwrap.conf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/astara/commit/f26ffd7222d8c4d57eccfdc1f6d4dbb4c0ae7e9c', 'message': 'Add /usr/local/{sbin,bin} to rootwrap exec_dirs

I noticed that nova, neutron and cinder's rootwrap exec_dirs include
/usr/local/{sbin,bin} which is a standardised location for admins to
install non-distro executables, and these executables are no less
"trustworthy" than /usr/bin and friends.  See neutron and cinder's
rootwrap.conf (and probably others), and typical distro default values
for sudoers/secure_path for extremely similar precedents that all include
/usr/local/*bin.

See the same patch of nova for more information:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280052/1
And see I710cf142b834381c00e651cfc062299ae755c33f for brief discussion
of doing this via devstack before.

Change-Id: I1be8ff63d06424e84ea2b39bc0d285fe95beebb2
'}]
commit_message:
Add /usr/local/{sbin,bin} to rootwrap exec_dirs

I noticed that nova, neutron and cinder's rootwrap exec_dirs include
/usr/local/{sbin,bin} which is a standardised location for admins to
install non-distro executables, and these executables are no less
"trustworthy" than /usr/bin and friends.  See neutron and cinder's
rootwrap.conf (and probably others), and typical distro default values
for sudoers/secure_path for extremely similar precedents that all include
/usr/local/*bin.

See the same patch of nova for more information:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280052/1
And see I710cf142b834381c00e651cfc062299ae755c33f for brief discussion
of doing this via devstack before.

Change-Id: I1be8ff63d06424e84ea2b39bc0d285fe95beebb2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/astara refs/changes/79/282979/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exec_dirs=/sbin,/usr/sbin,/bin,/usr/bin,/usr/local/sbin,/usr/local/bin
